name: speed-test-schedule

datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

nkey.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: netgrp

POST.summary:
Create object(s) in this table.
 Access Group: netgrp

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: netgrp

DELETE.summary:
Delete this specific resource.
 Access Group: netgrp

help: Speed test schedule for each interface.

server-name.name: server-name
server-name.help: Speed test server name in system.speed-test-server list or leave it as empty to choose default server "FTNT_Auto".

mode.name: mode
mode.help: Protocol Auto(default), TCP or UDP used for speed test.

options.name: Auto
options.help: Dynamically selects TCP or UDP based on the speed test setting
options.label: Auto
options.description: Dynamically selects TCP or UDP based on the speed test setting

name.name: name
name.help: Name of a firewall recurring schedule.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable dynamic server.The speed test server will be found automatically.
options.label: Enable

ctrl-port.name: ctrl-port
ctrl-port.help: Port of the controller to get access token.

server-port.name: server-port
server-port.help: Port of the server to run speed test.

update-shaper.name: update-shaper
update-shaper.help: Set egress shaper based on the test result.

options.name: both
options.help: Update both local-side and remote-side egress shaper.
options.label: Both
options.description: Update both local-side and remote-side egress shaper

update-inbandwidth.name: update-inbandwidth
update-inbandwidth.help: Enable/disable bypassing interface's inbound bandwidth setting.

update-outbandwidth.name: update-outbandwidth
update-outbandwidth.help: Enable/disable bypassing interface's outbound bandwidth setting.

update-interface-shaping.name: update-interface-shaping
update-interface-shaping.help: Enable/disable using the speedtest results as reference for interface shaping (overriding configured in/outbandwidth).

update-inbandwidth-maximum.name: update-inbandwidth-maximum
update-inbandwidth-maximum.help: Maximum downloading bandwidth (kbps) to be used in a speed test.

update-inbandwidth-minimum.name: update-inbandwidth-minimum
update-inbandwidth-minimum.help: Minimum downloading bandwidth (kbps) to be considered effective.

update-outbandwidth-maximum.name: update-outbandwidth-maximum
update-outbandwidth-maximum.help: Maximum uploading bandwidth (kbps) to be used in a speed test.

update-outbandwidth-minimum.name: update-outbandwidth-minimum
update-outbandwidth-minimum.help: Minimum uploading bandwidth (kbps) to be considered effective.

expected-inbandwidth-minimum.name: expected-inbandwidth-minimum
expected-inbandwidth-minimum.help: Set the minimum inbandwidth threshold for applying speedtest results on shaping-profile.

expected-inbandwidth-maximum.name: expected-inbandwidth-maximum
expected-inbandwidth-maximum.help: Set the maximum inbandwidth threshold for applying speedtest results on shaping-profile.

expected-outbandwidth-minimum.name: expected-outbandwidth-minimum
expected-outbandwidth-minimum.help: Set the minimum outbandwidth threshold for applying speedtest results on shaping-profile.

expected-outbandwidth-maximum.name: expected-outbandwidth-maximum
expected-outbandwidth-maximum.help: Set the maximum outbandwidth threshold for applying speedtest results on shaping-profile.

retries.name: retries
retries.help: Maximum number of times the FortiGate unit will attempt to contact the same server before considering the speed test has failed (1 - 10, default = 5).

retry-pause.name: retry-pause
retry-pause.help: Number of seconds the FortiGate pauses between successive speed tests before trying a different server (60 - 3600, default = 300).
